introduction: The following passage is adapted from Composers of the Baroque Period by Lena Moore (2020).
text: Claudio Monteverdi’s early operas merged Renaissance polyphony with emerging Baroque forms. This combination of styles, marked by bold harmonies and dramatic expression, ______ the evolution of Western classical music.
question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English? Pay attention to the singular subject and the tense used to discuss historical influence.
explanation: Choice C is correct. The subject This combination is singular, so it takes the singular verb influences in a broad, timeless context. A influencing provides no main verb. B were influencing is plural. D influence is plural and doesn’t agree with combination.
